attributes.additional_details: The Family Nurse that has been seeing my daughter from the second week of finding out she was pregnant has been amazing they have created a special bond and created a lovely support network with us and our family unlike other young parents my daughter does not have a partner to help and support her she is doing this on her own with support from family but the biggest support is from the Family Nurse Partnership...today we found out that it is going to be stopped we are very sad about this .
attributes.background: My daughter was only 15yrs old when she fell pregnant and without the help and support and the relationship between her and the family nurse she wouldn't have the confidence and knowledge to give this baby the best support,yes as a family I am here but I can't learn her like professionals can .

rejection.details:
Your local Family Nurse Partnership is the responsibility of your local council. 

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Your local council may also have a petitions process.
